004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Joystick;
008import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event.EventLoop;
009import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandScheduler;
010
011/**
012 * A subclass of {@link Joystick} with {@link Trigger} factories for command-based.
013 *
014 * @see Joystick
015 */
016public class CommandJoystick extends Joystick {
017  /**
018   * Construct an instance of a controller.
019   *
020   * @param port The port index on the Driver Station that the controller is plugged into.
021   */
022  public CommandJoystick(int port) {
023    super(port);
024  }
025
026  @Override
027  public Trigger button(int button, EventLoop loop) {
028    return super.button(button, loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
029  }
030
031  /**
032   * Constructs an event instance around this button's digital signal.
033   *
034   * @param button the button index
035   * @return an event instance representing the button's digital signal attached to the {@link
036   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
037   * @see #button(int, EventLoop)
038   */
039  public Trigger button(int button) {
040    return button(button, CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
041  }
042
043  /**
044   * Constructs an event instance around the trigger button's digital signal.
045   *
046   * @return an event instance representing the trigger button's digital signal attached to the
047   *     {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
048   * @see #trigger(EventLoop)
049   */
050  public Trigger trigger() {
051    return trigger(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
052  }
053
054  @Override
055  public Trigger trigger(EventLoop loop) {
056    return super.trigger(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
057  }
058
059  /**
060   * Constructs an event instance around the top button's digital signal.
061   *
062   * @return an event instance representing the top button's digital signal attached to the {@link
063   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
064   * @see #top(EventLoop)
065   */
066  public Trigger top() {
067    return top(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
068  }
069
070  @Override
071  public Trigger top(EventLoop loop) {
072    return super.top(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
073  }
074}
